page.title: 02LOWER RUXTON FARM
page.content: Mr David Jenkins keeps sheep and cattle at the moment. He owns{500 sheep and loses approximately{12}a year because of disease. The average cost of a lamb is{Â£35}but it varies throughout the year. He puts{60}acres of his land aside for these animals. Mr Jenkins uses the rest of his land for crops. This year he is growing wheat, barley,sugar beet and potatoes. The wheat is sold for a good price and he feeds the barley and sugar beet tops to the animals. On the farm he keeps quite a lot of modern machinery and he uses it a lot. The soil varies throughout his land. It tends to be dry and gravelly in high places and moist down by the River Wye.
